utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gagh!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Problem?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This is the worst cobbler I’ve ever eaten. I mean it tastes like it was made of actual ground-up shoemaker.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amusing. A play on the two meanings of cobbler.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey guys, guess who I found at LAX. My baby sister Priya.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. I object. You propose a guessing game, yet you don’t give me enough time to guess. For the record, I was going to say your sister Priya.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon. You haven’t changed a bit, have you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would I change?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The hope has been that you’d eventually bend to public opinion. So, Priya, what brings you back to LA?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I have a one day layover on my way to Toronto. Corporate merger.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can you believe it? Little Priya’s one of the lead attorneys for the biggest car company in India.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Given that when we met her she was finishing law school and planning an internship at a large Indian car company, it’s actually extremely plausible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And your poll numbers just keep dropping.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I want to catch up with all of you, but first I really must visit the loo.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going too, I’ll show you where it is.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Alright, this goes without saying, but I’m just going to say it anyway. Hands off my sister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would I touch her, she’s covered with airplane germs.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m so not talking to you. I’m talking to him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve got a girlfriend now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh please. My sister’s much hotter than your girlfriend and you know it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s just agree they’re both hot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, that’s my sister you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, forget who’s hotter. The first time Priya came to LA, Leonard and I made a pact out of respect to our friendship, and to you, that neither of us would hit on her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did you pinky swear?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay then.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cobbler. I’m still laughing.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: It’s really nice to see you again Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s good to see you too. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, you got any special plans with your sister?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, not really, just hang out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I always tell people, if you have only one day in Los Angeles, make it a train day.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Train day?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The fun starts with brunch at Carney’s in Studio City, a hot dog stand in a converted railroad dining car. Next stop, Travel Town, an outdoor museum featuring 43 railroad engines, cars and other rolling stock from the 1880s to the 1930s. Finally, we’re off to the glitz and glamour of Hollywood for dinner at, that’s right, the Hollywood Carney’s, a hot dog stand in a different converted railroad dining car.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t think we’re going to do that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well then apparently, you hate fun.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm, Priya’s not back yet? Well, I guess that’s not unusual, women, men, the whole sitting, standing deal, so, what are we talking about?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, my plans with Priya.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He rejected train day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did you make it clear that it’s two different train cars turned into hot dog stands?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Abundantly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I guess he just hates fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s what I said.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Okay, so, what’s new with you guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have a girlfriend now.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hey, good for you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I just wanna put it out there in case I inadvertently squirt any pheromones in your direction. Happy? .

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, uh, Priya, what are your plans while you’re here.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I don’t know, I just have the one day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you like trains?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Not particularly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You might as well just wait at the airport for your flight.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You are in a forest. There is quicksand to the west, a path leads to the east. Go east. An iron gate blocks your way. Open gate. It’s locked. Hmm, well, so much for that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s getting pretty late, how come you’re still up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve found an emulator online that lets you play classic text based computer games from the 1980s.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s pretty cool.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh yes. It runs on the world’s most powerful graphics chip, imagination.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’ve really got to get out more.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Go north. You can’t go that way. Go west. A troll blocks your passage. Okay, fasten your seatbelts, kill troll. With what? With sword. You don’t have the sword. Good golly, it’s as if it’s actually happening to me.

utterance.speaker: Priya (at door)
utterance.content: Raj finally went to bed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, Sheldon’s still up.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: You said he goes to bed at nine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, he does but he got caught up in a computer game and…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hit troll with axe. Hit troll with axe. Hit troll with axe. Oh my, this is one tough troll.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Can’t you get rid of him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If the past is any indication, no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I’m trapped in quicksand, the axe is dragging me down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Drop axe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Drop axe. Brilliant.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Give me a minute. Sheldon,

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hold on. I have to figure out how to get the bucket, so I can carry the mud past the dragon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you need to work in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well then, bed mister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Five more minutes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? You’re going to risk getting sleepy in the middle of your thermodynamic fluctuations seminar? You know what happens when you yawn in public.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Everyone will see my oddly shaped uvula.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You don’t want that, do you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. But it’s a shame our society mocks the differently uvulated. Who was at the door?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, uh, building manager. They have to fix a pipe so the water will be off tomorrow from noon to two.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s unacceptable. We’re supposed to be given written notice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, it doesn’t matter, we’ll be at work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, what if I spill tomato soup on my shirt and have to come home to change, only to find there’s no water for an enzyme soak.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bifurcated uvula, Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll have the chicken noodle. Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (to Priya)
utterance.content: We’re going to have to be very quiet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know how to get the bucket! I can turn the axe around and use the handle to reach it. Let’s see. Go north. You are in a forest. Go north. You are in a forest. Go north. You are in a forest. Oh dear, I believe I’m lost. Well, I’ll just have to get a fresh start tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. You just need, you just need, you just need to map it out. Come on, I’ll help you. So, uh, you stopped at the stream and you turned north three times?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re right, you’re lost, good luck.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh! Leonard, wake up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh! Sorry!

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. When I’m in bed with a girl, it’s just, it’s my go to response.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: It’s six o’ clock, I have to get back to Raj’s before he wakes up and realises I’m gone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, right, sure. I wish you could stay in LA a while longer.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Mmm. Me too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, I was thinking, there are some great research facilities in India.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Where are you going with this, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I’m just saying, I don’t have any real ties here, so if I were to move to New Delhi we could, you know, go out.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Leonard, didn’t we have this conversation five years ago.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, yes, but, things have changed, you know, you’re older, I’m older. Look, no more superhero bedsheets.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Sweetheart, just because we have fun when I come to town doesn’t mean I want to have a serious relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It doesn’t?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Mm-mm. And besides, I could never bring a white boy home to my parents. They’d have a cow. Which is a much bigger deal in India.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not that white. My great-great grandmother was half Cherokee. I know that’s not the right kind of Indian but it is something.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Aha, you’re funny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard. Leonard. Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I heard a woman laughing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, uh, yeah, I was trying to see if I could laugh as a woman.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well, good job, quite convincing. I smell perfume.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Air freshener.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And is that lipstick on your cheek and neck.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, rash, that’s a bad rash.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My sympathies. I am no stranger to the crimson scourge that is dermatitis. Can I interest you in a topical steroid from my lotion and unguent collection?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, yeah, that sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well, I’m sure I can find something that will help you ditch that itch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, he’s in the bathroom, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you prefer ointment or cream?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, cream.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: With or without a numbing agent?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Without.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? Leonard, there are no heroes when it comes to dermatitis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. With.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Prescription or non-prescription strength.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Use your best judgement.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I think I have a nice 2009 AnaMantle HC. It’s usually indicated for acutely inflamed haemorrhoids, but it also goes nicely with non mucosal body parts.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent choice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (whispering)
utterance.content: Right, right, alright.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Priya?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Good morning, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For shame, Leonard. For shame. And to think I was ready to waste the last of my good haemorrhoid cream on you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Making pretty good time, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that really what you want to talk about, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do you want to talk about?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Please don’t tell anyone I spent the night with Raj’s sister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There it is. What if someone asks?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No-one’s going to ask if I spent the night with Raj’s sister.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps. But they might ask me something else.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Like, has Leonard betrayed any of his friends recently?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Priya and I are both adults. We didn’t betray Raj.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In fact, you did, but I was referring to Howard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: April 12th, 2005, Bob’s Big Boy, Toluca Lake. Raj had just introduced us to Priya for the first time, and she was enjoying the sweet taste of Hindu rebellion in the form of a Bob’s Super Big Boy hamburger. In order to preserve your friendship, you and Howard made a pinky swear that neither of you would attempt to woo her. I had a patty melt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, fine, I betrayed Howard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And Raj.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alright, and Raj.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Violation of the roommate agreement, overnight guest notification clause.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay fine, I’m, I’m a horrible human being, I’m the Darth Vader of Pasadena.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re far too short to be Darth Vader. At best you might be a turncoat Ewok.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My point is, Priya’s gone. And it would be much better if no-one else found out about this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mean, you want me to keep a secret.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know I can’t keep a secret.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can if you try. Think about it this way, if I were Batman and you were Alfred, you’d keep that secret. Right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why do you get to be Batman?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because, well, Batman has the secret.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well Alfred has secrets too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alfred knows that Barbara Gordon is Batgirl. Which I’ve now just told to Batman. See, I can’t keep a secret.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ta-da!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ta-da. It’s short for da-da-da-da!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Kind of busy here, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know, that’s why I shortened it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I came to go over your alibi for last night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What alibi?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’ve asked me to lie on your behalf, and as you know, I am deeply uncomfortable with impromptu dishonest, so I’ve provided you with an iron clad alibi. You couldn’t have spent last night with Priya, because you were with another woman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so sure I’m going to regret this, but, who was I with?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The fun loving, and morally loose, Miss Maggie McGeary.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You met her at Pasadena’s most popular Irish watering hole, Lucky Baldwin’s, where Maggie spends her nights tending bar, with a head full of curls and a heart full of dreams.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (reading a napkin Sheldon has handed him)
utterance.content: Leonard, call me if you’re interested in coitus. Sincerely, Maggie McGeary.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And if anyone were to actually call that number they will hear this.

utterance.speaker: Mechanical voice on Sheldon’s phone
utterance.content: Top of the morning to you. You’ve reached Maggie McGeary. Leave a message after the wee little beep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s pretty convincing, huh? And it wasn’t even a real person. And here is the clincher. A lock of Maggie’s flaming auburn hair.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where did you get that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: From an orang-u-tan in the primate lab.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: An orang-u-tan?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, no-one’s going to run a DNA test on it, Leonard, honestly you over-think everything.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I don’t need an alibi. Nobody’s going to ask about last night as long as you just zip your lip. Thankyou. Now don’t worry, everything is going to be fine. (Sheldon writes “I doubt it” on Leonard’s whiteboard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, will you please tell Howard my sister’s never been attracted to him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: C’mon Raj, how am I supposed to know who she’s attracted to. Or was attracted to. Or who she might be attracted to. In the future.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I have nothing to contribute to this conversation. Because I too know absolutely nothing about Priya’s preferences in male companionship. And with that, I will re-zip my lip.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, so what did you guys think of the new episode of Caprica last night?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t see it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Didn’t see it? What were you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I was out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: On Caprica night?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I, uh, went for a drink.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really, you, and where, where did you go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To, uh, Lucky Baldwin’s.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’ve heard of that place, isn’t that Pasadena’s favourite Irish watering hole.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you meet anyone interesting there, perhaps a promiscuous redheaded barmaid?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: As a matter of fact I.. I… I can’t… I can’t… I can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sure you can, you’re doing fine, it’s very believable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I’m sorry Raj, but the truth is I was with Priya last night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t listen to him, he’s still light headed from all the Irish whiskey and pickled eggs in his system.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What were you doing with Priya?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe they engaged in coitus but, more importantly, if Leonard had not abandoned his story, would you have found it plausible?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? You slept with my sister?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How could you? We had a pact!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me, I think how could you she’s my sister takes precedence over a five year old pinky swear!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: May I point out, in a parallel universe, your friends are saying Maggie McGeary, she sounds lovely.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I admit it, I may have crossed a line here, but come on, Raj, your sister is a grown woman. To her, I’m a forbidden piece of white chocolate.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I… I don’t believe it, this is a terrible betrayal of my trust.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no, would it help if I told you that I offered her my heart and she kind of stomped on it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How hard did she stomp?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Very hard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, I’m good.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, Raj, I just want to say that I’d never betray your trust. Unlike Leonard, I respect you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Was it out of respect that you didn’t tell Raj about the time you dropped his iPhone in a urinal?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude! I put that thing on my face!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think a more amusing violation of Raj’s trust is when Howard convinced him that foreigners give presents to Americans on Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I didn’t see you giving back your Snoopy snowcone maker.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That was all a lie? This year’s gifts are already wrapped!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And as long as we’re talking about betraying our friends, how about the month Sheldon spent grinding up insects and mixing them into Leonard’s food.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, excuse me. That was not a betrayal, that was an experiment to determine at what concentration food starts tasting mothy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You put moths in my food?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For science.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t believe you kissed my sister with moth mouth.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, uh, I can’t believe you used Sheldon’s toothbrush.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You used my toothbrush?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not the brush part, just the little rubber thing to pick food from my teeth and massage my gums.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I, I, I think it’s safe to say that we’ve all done some things we’re not particularly proud of. But come on, we’re friends. Friends overlook each other’s minor lapses. For the record, Howard, I’m sorry that I broke our pact.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thankyou, and I’m sorry about your phone. And Thanksgiving. And while we’re at it, you don’t have to wash our clothes on the fourth of July.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: As long as we’re apologising, Sheldon, I, I’m sorry I used your toothbrush.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I’m sorry. But that behaviour is beyond the pale and cannot be tolerated. We are no longer friends.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I got you a talking Thomas the Tank Engine for Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: With real puffing smoke?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alright. But I’m watching you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you got Snoopy out. Can I have a snowcone?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
